message: You try to push the door open, but it's blocked from the inside. Best to try the other door.
With all that gold that you helped us get back, we plan to fix the bridge so we will be able to ship our beer to the west.

replies.text: Oh, that's great news indeed! It's going to make my life easier.

message: Don't you know? The bridge that crosses over the Sutdover River that flows between here and Stoutford. It's been broken for a while now.
It should be ready by the time you get there.
The bridge that crosses over the Sutdover River has been repaired thanks to you.

replies.text: Yes. I am aware. In fact, I've already used it.

message: You can't continue over the broken boards. It's time to turn around and find another way across.
Hey, kid! Just where do you think you're going?

replies.text: Across the bridge, of course. After all, I can't swim.

message: The bridge is broken. You're going nowhere.
Let me guess, you're wondering if I know how to cross the river?
Please move along. There's nothing to see here.
Well, as a matter of fact, I do. I have a board right here under the bridge that you can place over the hole. But it's going to cost you 1000 gold.

replies.text: Wow! All you thieves are alike. Here, take it.

message: Great! Now, let me see. Where is that board?
Seraphina bends down to look under the bridge.
Um, it's not here.

replies.text: What do you mean "it's not here"? Where is it?

message: It must have drifted down river. Sorry!
Maybe next time you come by I'll have the board?
Why are you looking at me like that?

replies.text: I want my gold back. You thief!

message: I'm just the muscle around here. Go talk to Defy.
I'm just the...um...
Um, yes. One of those.
Are you lost, kid?
Shh! What was that? Did you guys here that?
I heard nothing. Greedy, you need to relax. Here, have a Bandit's Brew.
There it is again! Please tell me that you guys heard that?
Greedy! That's enough! Stop it. We are safe here.

replies.text: Wait a minute, I recognize those guys.

message: Ugh. Whatever.
You should get a better understanding of who these men are before you crash the party.
Lookie what we have here! Sullengard's five most wanted men, all in one location. This is my lucky day.
Oh, it's the child from Crossglen. Umar's little toy.
Why are you yelling from across the woods? Please walk over here and we can talk.
Oh, how interesting your timing is.
Well, you see, we are in kind of a predicament.

replies.text: Oh, you are feeling guility for what you did to the great people of Sullengard and want to turn yourselves in, but don't want to go to jail?

message: Now that's funny. No! Now back to what I was trying to tell you...
We are planning a heist, but we need your "skills" to pull it off.
Please. Just hear me out.
We have knowledge of this vast repository of gold and other treasures, but it is well secured under lock and key.

replies.text: OK. You had me at "treasures". Please go on.
And you want me to help you return it to its rightful owners?

message: The problem of needing the key is where your "skills" come in.

replies.text: These "skills" that you keep mentioning, what are they?

message: [Laughing loudly]. Kid, you are certainly as funny as you are funny looking, I'll tell you that right now. Now, back on topic...
I was just getting to that. If you would stop interrupting me, I could get to the plan quicker and how you play a major role in it.

replies.text: A "major" role you said. So what, I get fifty percent of the loot?

message: Again with the humor. No, you will not be getting fifty percent. Anyways...
Well, before I get into any more details. Hey Alaric [the lost traveler's real name], do we trust this kid enough to tell him the details?
Well Defy, $playername did let me go after discovering my crime.

replies.text: [Keep quiet about the facts and agree, for now] That's true.

message: That's fair enough. Now let us move on to the details, shall we?

replies.text: Yes, please. I'm getting bored here.

message: You see, we want to get back some of what is ours. What we helped to accumulate over the years. We want to hit them where it really hurts.
Well, yes. But not right now. Those adventures are too big for us right now.
I'm talking about the Thieves Guild.

replies.text: Why would you want to do that?

message: Exactly!

Well, for starters, Umar and his sidekick brother have wronged us over and over again. Keeping all the wealth for themselves. And don't even get me started on the emotional stress and abuse we suffer from at their hands.
You know what I am talking about, don't you?

replies.text: I'm not so sure that I do.
Actually, yeah, kind of. Well, at least that thought has crossed my mind once or twice recently.

message: Come on, $playername. Open your eyes. Think. Your are just a tool to him. Something for him to use to accomplish whatever his agenda is that day.

replies.text: Actually, yeah, kind of. Well, at least that thought has crossed my mind once or twice recently.
I'm not so sure, but please, get on with your plan.

message: Anyways... The Guild has a vault. A repository of treasures and wealth hidden and secure in a location just south of Fallhaven.

replies.text: I've been all around the Fallhaven area a thousand times and I've never seen any vault.
I don't believe you. I would have stumbled across it.

message: Oh, trust me, it's there all right.

replies.text: Trust you? You want me to trust you? A dishonorable thief? Where is it then?
Tell me. I want to know.

message: Are you familiar with that vacant house southwest of Fallhaven? The one next to the cliffside?
The entrance to it is found inside that house. It's hidden and secured. You will need to find the passage that leads underground in order to gain access.

replies.text: That sounds easy. I'll do it.
I guess I can try and get in there.

message: You won't be doing it.
No. We will be doing that.

replies.text: Then what do you need from me?

message: What I need from you is more of an inside job. I need you to get the key to the vault from Troublemaker without him suspecting any trickery. Do you think you can handle that?

replies.text: Why should I help you? What do I get out of this?
If I do this for you, then I expect to get paid!

message: Oh, you aren't as dumb as you are funny.
How does 10 percent of the total treasure sound?

replies.text: Nope. I will go no lower than 25 percent
I'll do it for twice that amount. 20 percent.

message: Fine! [Shh] I'll take it out of Greedy's portion. He'll never know the difference.
We will be leaving this campsite in favor of our hideout. Meet up with me there and you can give me the key then.

replies.text: Sounds good, but where is your hideout?

message: It's where the rail tracks end. West of the Sutdover River.

replies.text: The Sutdover River? Where is it?

message: The Sutdover River flows between Sullengard and Stoutford.
As you sneak a peek inside, a terrifying voice yells out. Warning you not to step foot inside.
Go talk to Defy. I have nothing to say to you.
Great! Give it to me and when I have time, whenever that may be, I will add it to our bank.

replies.text: Well, if you are so busy, I don't mind making the deposit for the greater good.

message: Hmm... well I guess you could do that for me considering Umar trusts you a lot.

replies.text: Great! Just tell me where to go and you can consider it done.

message: Well, it's not that easy. You need more than the location. You need this key.

replies.text: Thanks, but where is the vault located?

message: You can find the empty house just south of here. Enter it and you will find your way.

replies.text: Thank you so much! I will bring the key back as quick as possible.

message: You what? How? Where? Tell me all you know.

replies.text: I found them by pure luck, really.

message: Where did you find them?

replies.text: Southeast of Deebo's orchard. They were simply sitting in the woods around a campfire enjoying some of Sullengard's "Bandit Brews".

message: What else can you tell me?

replies.text: They wanted to hire me to rob you guys. Defy wants your stash of gold and treasures.

message: Really? What did you say?

replies.text: Well, I agreed to, but only because I want to help you guys catch him.

message: You know, $playername, for just being a young adventurer, you are learning a lot.

replies.text: Thanks a lot. I do feel a lot smarter now than I did before joining your guild.

message: Listen, kid. Let's use this to our advantage. Take this fake key, bring it to Defy and we will be waiting for them at the vault.

replies.text: Sir, that sounds like a great plan. What do you want me to do after handing him the fake key?

message: You should go with them to the vault as we may need your help there.

replies.text: Great! Just tell me where to go and you can consider it done.

message: You can find the empty house just south east of here. Enter it and you will find your way.
It's so weird working with you after all that we've gone through.

replies.text: I would love nothing more than to see you punished for your crimes.
What are you waiting for? Go take the fake key to Troublemaker.

message: Do you have the key? Hand it over.

replies.text: Oops. I forgot to bring it with me. I'll be back soon.
Yes, but you are not having it. I will loot the vault myself and keep everything I find.

message: Thank you so much. Now take this fake key that Zachlanny's has made and return it to Troublemaker before he suspects anything. Then meet us at the vault to collect your share of the loot.
Thank you very much!
I'm rich. I'm finally rich!

replies.text: Only in gold. You have no friends.

message: Here is your reward for your role in our success.

replies.text: It was nice doing business with you.

message: We are leaving now. Too close to Fallhaven for my liking.
Come again?

replies.text: You heard me the first time. I'm keeping the key and looting the vault myself.

message: I will be taking that key now!
I have killed Defy, his three helpers and Alaric. I really should go back to Fallhaven and talk to Troublemaker again.
You what? How? Where? Tell me all you know.

replies.text: Your never going to believe this, but they were inside that vacant house when I walked in.

message: Then what happened?

replies.text: They looked up to no good, so I questioned them. Then the next thing I know, I'm enthralled in the heat of battle and they are dead.

message: Can you prove this? Can you show me something that proves that all 4 are dead?

replies.text: Yes. I looted their rings. [Shows them to Troublemaker]
Yes. I looted their rings, but I forgot to bring them with me. I'll come back.

message: Well, this is great news indeed. We however would like to have them alive.
Thank you so much. Now take this fake key that Zachlanny's has made and return it to Troublemaker before he suspects anything. Then meet us at the vault to collect your share of the loot.
Ah, $playername has finally returned. Please, take this crystal and some gold as our thanks to you.
You will be happy to hear that we have captured Defy and his four accomplices before they could steal from us.

replies.text: That's great news indeed. Where are they now?

message: We are keeping them in our holding cage in Fallhaven.

replies.text: Is there anything else that I should know about?

message: Yes. That fifth man, the one that was not one of us...
His name is not important to me...
We've learned that he was part of a crime in Sullengard. You may want to visit Sullengard and inform them that we have their guy.
I am here now to watch out for suspicious activity and people.
Hey, you are just the person that I wanted to see. I've been wondering that with all of your adventures, have you encountered "the lost traveler" again?
Where? Can you get him back here to be punished?

replies.text: Actually, he is in a Fallhaven jail. Locked up with Defy in fact. I was able to capture them and lock them up there.
Actually, I had a chance encounter with him and after attempting to drag him back here, he attacked me and I had no other option than to end his life.

message: Oh, thank you so much!

replies.text: Of course. It was my pleasure.

message: Well, I would have preferred to see him punished instead of killed, but thank you so much for putting an end to all this.

replies.text: Of course. It was my pleasure.

message: Please, take this as a gift of gratitude.
I don't know if you will like it, but let me tell you, nobody down here wants it.

replies.text: Oh, really? I will play with it. Thanks again.

message: As you step between the trees, the crunch of the dry leaves beneath your feet startle you.
As you step between the trees, the crunch of the dry leaves beneath your feet startle you.
Do you want to unlock the hatch?
The lock creaks open, revealing a staircase.
Oh, gross! It's full of spiders.
Do you have the key? Hand it over.

replies.text: Yes, Here it is. [Handing over the fake key]

message: You will regret this, kid!
Do I know you?

replies.text: Oh, you want to play dumb? Umar will hear about this!

message: I should come back with the Thieves Guild key.
Thank you very much!

replies.text: I encountered Defy and his men and was forced to kill them!

message: Did you hear about the kidnapping?
[Looking extermely confused and terrified] ... Well, why would it be you?
[Looking extermely confused] ... Who?
Well, while you were off hunting and killing that giant snake, I had a customer.
A customer with a very interesting report about a kidnapped girl and a witch.
That's the thing. He is no longer here. He just left before you walked in.
You should ask around town if anyone has seen or heard about it.

replies.text: OK. I think I will do that. Thanks.
OK, but first please give me something to drink.

message: Of course, my dear.

replies.text: Did you see a witch around here or hear about a witch kidnapping a girl?

message: No, I'm sorry, I didn't.
Hello there. Please do not bother me, I have a lot of work to do.

replies.text: Can I have just one minute of your time, please?
Could you tell me the story about the wicked witch again?

message: I suppose.

replies.text: Great! I was wondering if you know anything about a kidnapping or a witch?

message: [Taken aback by the question] What did you just ask me?

replies.text: I asked if you know anything about a witch and the possibility that she took a girl.

message: Leave me alone! I don't want to talk about her!

replies.text: So you know something about the kidnapping?
What about the witch? Do you know something about her?

message: Nope!
I may, but I don't want to tell you about her as I am terrified of her.

replies.text: Wow! Now I have to learn what you know. Please tell me your story.

message: No way! I have no way to protect myself and believe me, I will need to if I tell you anything.

replies.text: I will protect you. Trust me.

message: [Laughing uncontrollably] ... You? You are just a child of a farmer. So you are weaker than I am.
Of course I do. He lives a stones throw away from me and we are both farmers.

replies.text: Oh. I didn't know. But I can protect you.

message: And how can you do that? Have you ever done anything like this before?

replies.text: Well, actually, I have. In fact, I just finished protecting this entire town from a giant snake.

message: That was you?
Well, if that's the case, then I will tell you my story.
My story starts a very long time ago, when I was just a kid.
You see, one day, my best friend Addie and I were playing amongst the trees south of town when we encountered her.
She was a young beautiful woman, but terrifyingly alluring. So much so, that she easily coerced us into following her into her house.
Now, I will tell you right now that I have chosen to block out most of the details as it was such a painful experience.
All I remember was being kept in a dark room for what felt like weeks without food and being alone. You see, the witch kept Addie in another room ... I think.
Yes. You see, after I escaped, I never saw Addie again.
After a couple of weeks passed, I saw a chance to escape and I took it. Never to look back and never to talk about it. Well, until now.

replies.text: Thank you for telling me your story. I want to stop this witch once and for all. Where can I find her?

message: Thank you! You can find her house just south of here. You can't miss it as it is covered in beautiful flowers.
While raising your arm and waving your hand, you yell over the water: "Excuse me."
Shh. You are scaring the fish.

replies.text: Please? I need your help. I'm looking for my brother. His name is Andor. He looks like me. Have you seen him?
That's a really cool boat. Where can I get one?
[While Pointing behind Isobel, you yell] Look at the size of that fish behind you!

message: Where?!

replies.text: [While laughing uncontrollably] "Shh, your scaring him away."

message: Excuse me, young one! Wait! Thank you for sparing me earlier. You've shown true compassion.

replies.text: What ... do I know you? You're just a young girl?

message: Yes, I was under a spell that made me appear as the witch. She wanted to test your heart. I'm glad you proved kind.

replies.text: Thank you, but you don't look well.

message: I am not well. Which is why I have not run far from this awful place and this awful witch.

replies.text: What's wrong? Why can't you leave?
What happened to you here? How did you get here?

message: Thank you again, my savior! I will go now.
I need nutrients! You see, I've been held down in that basement of that horrific house for what feels like a year.
I am too sick to talk about this right now.
All the witch ever gave me is something called 'Tonic of Blood'. At first, I refused to drink it, but soon I became desperate and I drank it.

replies.text: I've had one or two of those. They are not that bad.
Are those things even good for you?

message: Yes, maybe in moderation. But after a few dozen, they do something to your body as I can no longer consume anything but them.
I really need to get my hands on a lot of those 'Tonic of Blood' potions. Can you help me? I need a lot.

replies.text: Well, I have twenty-five of those for you.
Well, I have twenty of those for you.
Well, I have ten of those for you.
Well, I have five of those for you and I'm not sure where I got them. Do you know where I can get some?
Well, I only have one of those for you and I don't remember where I got it. Do you know where I can get some more?
I'm sorry, but I don't have any of those.

message: Well, I am not eactly sure about that as the witch would make it. Damn! I hate that smell. Damn! I love that taste however.

replies.text: Can you help me out a little bit? Do you know anything about them?

message: Hold on. Let me think....
Ah, YES. I remember her saying that an "undead" friend of her's east of here tought her how to make them.

replies.text: OK. Stay here. I will be back with more of them.

message: Can you get me twenty-five of them?
Only twenty? I was really hoping for twenty-five.

replies.text: Whatever! Fine. I will go get you five more.
I know that you "asked" for twenty-five, but I have twenty and they are hard to get. Please take these.

message: OK. I won't make you go back just for five more when you've already brought me twenty.
WOW! You actually managed to find twenty-five! I am so grateful.
Before you go, I was able to steal this from the witch as I was escaping. I want you to have it. I need to go now.
Oh my, what have we here? Another brave soul seeking to challenge me?

replies.text: [While backing up] Me? No ma'am. I just wandered into the wrong house. Please don't hurt me.
Halt, foul witch! Your reign of darkness ends here!

message: And with such polite manners too. Come. Come. Take a seat.

replies.text: Your tricks won't work on me. Prepare to meet your end!
Witches don't bother me. I'll leave you be.

message: How intriguing. Such confidence in your path. We shall see, won't we?
Oh, the "confident child". Please leave me to my business.
[laughs] How amusing. You're not the first to try, and you won't be the last. But do go ahead, if you must.
Oh, this fight will be fun ... for me that is.
As the "witch" dies, she begins to transform into her true form, revealing a young girl and you quickly realize the tragedy of your choices. When all of a sudden...
Bravo, hero! You fell right into my trap.
Oh, but it is. You see, that old witch you slew was nothing more than an illusion. A clever ruse to manipulate your actions.
I am the real witch, and you've played right into my hands. That display of arrogance, that thirst for victory - perfect for my amusement.

replies.text: [angry] You won't get away with this!

message: [chuckles] You can certainly try, my dear hero. But your bravado has already cost you.

replies.text: You're the one that will pay!

message: After defeating the real witch, she quickly reappears.

replies.text: What did you mean when you said "what lies ahead"?

message: [weakened] Yes, yes, you've bested me. Congratulations, but have you really won?
Oh, just a bit of entertainment. And for that, you get a big reward: You get to live.

replies.text: [disgruntled] Is this some kind of sick game to you?

message: [smirks] Perhaps. But remember, hero, life's full of surprises. You may have won this time, but who's to say what lies ahead?
Leave me now, child before you end up like that young girl you killed.
I need to go now. Thanks a lot.
There is nothing to see here except for that wolf dung over there. Gross!
Look what I have found here - bewitched crystals! They are really fun!
I wonder if there are more of them in the area?
You're here to take our magical mushroom!

replies.text: No, I swear. Please don't hurt me.

message: We are in a rush to get through here, kid. Get out of our way or die.

replies.text: Where is the Shadow to help me now?

message: Meow.
Hello, my name is "Old Blue".

replies.text: You are an unusual color. Why are you blue?

message: Talk? Well, let me ask you this: Why don't my friends up there talk?

replies.text: Well, I guess you've got me there.

message: It was Bonicksa, that wicked witch, she did this to me.
Well, you see those rats over there? The ones in the cage?
You see, those things are delicious.

replies.text: Um, OK, but what does that have to do with Bonicksa?

message: Oh, you don't know? Those are Bonicksa's rats and she doesn't appreciate anything happening to them.
She caught me killing her favorite one day. I got away that day, but she was relentless in her attempts to hurt me.
Well, after many months of trying, she was lucky one day and was able to capture me.
She used her black magic to turn my beautiful white fur to this awful color I am now.

replies.text: Oh, I am so sorry for you.

message: Oh, yes. I was asking you what you said to Defy after learning that they wanted to hire you to rob us. Then you so rudely left the conversation. So I will ask you again. What did you say?

replies.text: Well, I agreed to, but only because I want to help you guys catch him.

message: Seriously? Man, it is so hard to get good help nowadays! I instructed you to go with them to the vault as we may need your help there.
